Package com.l2h1.tamagotchi.model.states

Class State

java.lang.Object
com.l2h1.tamagotchi.model.states.State
Direct Known Subclasses:
State.EntertainmentState, State.FatigueState, State.HealthState, State.HungerState, State.HygieneState, State.SociabilityState
public abstract class State extends Object
A state is a characteristic of a LivingEntity. This class abstractly represents what is more concretely a progress bar. All states have a name, a type and a value. But each state that inherits from this State class can redefine the way it loses value with each tick (see LivingEntity), the way it is in a critical state or the way it is in an over state. Each state also has its own State.CriticalType(s), whose logic depends on its own attributes; but also its own State.DeathType(s). Each state must redefine its own simulation logic.

This class, which is an important part of the backend, is designed to be scalable according to the wishes of future developers.

  • Method Details

    • getStringName

      public String getStringName()
      Retrieves the name of this state.
      Returns:
      the name of this state

    • getType

      public State.StateType getType()
      Retrieves the State.StateType of this state.
      Returns:
      the State.StateType of this state

    • getValue

      public double getValue()
      Retrieves the value of this state.
      Returns:
      the value of this state

    • setValue

      public void setValue(double value)
      Sets the value of this state
      Parameters:
      value - the new value of this state

    • increase

      public void increase(double value)
      Increases the state value by the specified value.

      Calling this method has no effect if the new state value exceeds the STATE_GENERAL_MAX_VALUE.

      Parameters:
      value - the value to be added to the state value

    • decrease

      public void decrease(double value)
      Decreases the state value by the specified value.

      Calling this method has no effect if the new state value is below the STATE_GENERAL_MIN_VALUE.

      Parameters:
      value - the value to be subtracted from the state value

    • decreaseTick

      public abstract void decreaseTick(int ticks)
      Represents how the state loses value with each tick. The state that implements this method can decide to multiply the specified number of ticks by a constant, or to customize the way it loses value with each tick.
      Parameters:
      ticks - the number of ticks to make the loss of value depend on the state

    • isValueCritical

      public abstract boolean isValueCritical()
      Represents how a state is critical according to its value.
      Returns:
      true if this state is critical, false otherwise

    • isOver

      public abstract boolean isOver()
      Represents how a state is in a state above the limits (i.e. if it no longer has any reason to be updated) as a function (or not) of its value.
      Returns:
      true if this state is over, false otherwise

    • getCriticalType

      public abstract State.CriticalType getCriticalType()
      Represents the State.CriticalType of state to be returned depending (or not) on its value.

      However, a state can only have one critical type at a time.

      Returns:
      the State.CriticalType depending (or not) the state value

    • getDeathType

      public abstract State.DeathType getDeathType()
      Represents the State.DeathType of state to be returned depending (or not) on its value.

      However, a state can only have one death type at a time.

      Returns:
      the State.DeathType depending (or not) the state value
